intro: Euphrasia arctica subsp. tenuis, commonly known as the slender eyebright, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It features small, yellowish-orange flowers with distinctive spurred petals, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. The plant has hairy, linear leaves that are adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas. Euphrasia arctica subsp. tenuis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological and evolutionary significance.
